intro: Cardanthera anomala, commonly known as the pale coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Cardanthera anomala is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid environments.
